Package nswalke4.smallbpayroll.util

Class Account

  • java.lang.Object
    • nswalke4.smallbpayroll.util.Account
  • public class Account
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains the Account object that is used in the database for the Payroll application.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Account​(int pId, java.lang.String pName, java.lang.String pEmail, java.lang.String pSub, PayPeriod.PayPeriodType pPeriodType)
      Create's an Account object based off of the given information.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      java.lang.String generateEmployeeID()
      Generates an employee ID number using the account ID and the number of employees that the account has, up to 9999 employees.
      java.sql.Date generateEndDate​(java.sql.Date startDate)
      Generates the end date of a PayPeriod by using the given start date and the account's information about the type of PayPeriod it uses to calculate the PayPeriod's end date.
      java.lang.String generatePayPeriodID()
      Generates a pay period ID number using the account ID and the number of pay periods that the account has, up to 9999 pay periods.
      java.lang.String getEmail()
      Get's the email of the account object.
      java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​Employee> getEmployees()
      Get's the hash map of all employees that are connected to the account object using the employee's id as the key and the employee object as the value.
      int getId()
      Get's the id of the account object.
      java.lang.String getName()
      Get's the name of the account object.
      java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​PayPeriod> getPayPeriods()
      Get's the hash map of all the pay periods that are connected to the account object using the pay period's id as the key and the PayPeriod object as the value.
      PayPeriod.PayPeriodType getPeriodType()
      Get's the pay period type of the account object.
      java.lang.String getSub()
      Get's the sub (which is the AWS Cognito id) of the account object.
      org.json.JSONObject makeIntoJSONObject()
      Collects all of the information about the Account object and then creates a JSONObject representation of all of that information (including the basic info about the Account object [excluding the AccountSub], basic info about all of the Employees tied to this account, and basic info about all of the PayPeriods tied to this account.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Account

        public Account​(int pId,
               java.lang.String pName,
               java.lang.String pEmail,
               java.lang.String pSub,
               PayPeriod.PayPeriodType pPeriodType)
        Create's an Account object based off of the given information.
        Parameters:
        pId - the id of the account object
        pName - the name of the account object
        pEmail - the email of the account object
        pSub - the AWS Cognito-generated 'sub' id for the account object
        pPeriodType - the pay period type of the account object

    • Method Detail

      • getId

        public int getId()
        Get's the id of the account object.
        Returns:
        the id of the account object

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Get's the name of the account object.
        Returns:
        the name of the account object

      • getEmail

        public java.lang.String getEmail()
        Get's the email of the account object.
        Returns:
        the email of the account object

      • getSub

        public java.lang.String getSub()
        Get's the sub (which is the AWS Cognito id) of the account object.
        Returns:
        the sub of the account object

      • getPeriodType

        public PayPeriod.PayPeriodType getPeriodType()
        Get's the pay period type of the account object.
        Returns:
        the periodType of the account object

      • getEmployees

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​Employee> getEmployees()
        Get's the hash map of all employees that are connected to the account object using the employee's id as the key and the employee object as the value.
        Returns:
        the HashMap of the employees of the account object

      • getPayPeriods

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​PayPeriod> getPayPeriods()
        Get's the hash map of all the pay periods that are connected to the account object using the pay period's id as the key and the PayPeriod object as the value.
        Returns:
        the HashMap of the pay periods of the account object

      • generateEmployeeID

        public java.lang.String generateEmployeeID()
        Generates an employee ID number using the account ID and the number of employees that the account has, up to 9999 employees. Style: "[AccountID]-E-[# of Employees, with leading zeros to make 4 digits]"
        Returns:
        the generated EmployeeID string

      • generateEndDate

        public java.sql.Date generateEndDate​(java.sql.Date startDate)
        Generates the end date of a PayPeriod by using the given start date and the account's information about the type of PayPeriod it uses to calculate the PayPeriod's end date.
        Parameters:
        startDate - the date that the PayPeriod begins
        Returns:
        the last day of the PayPeriod (is included in the period)

      • generatePayPeriodID

        public java.lang.String generatePayPeriodID()
        Generates a pay period ID number using the account ID and the number of pay periods that the account has, up to 9999 pay periods. Style: "[AccountID]-P-[# of PayPeriods, with leading zeros to make 4 digits]"
        Returns:
        the generated PayPeriodID string

      • makeIntoJSONObject

        public org.json.JSONObject makeIntoJSONObject()
        Collects all of the information about the Account object and then creates a JSONObject representation of all of that information (including the basic info about the Account object [excluding the AccountSub], basic info about all of the Employees tied to this account, and basic info about all of the PayPeriods tied to this account.
        Returns:
        a JSONObject representation of an Account object as well as all of its Employees and PayPeriods
